name: Intercultural Communication
description: The route to global cooperation or global collision. This course will use a case-based approach to the study of the impact of globalization and information technologies on the formulation of relationships between people of diverse racial, ethnic, national, linguistic, and religious backgrounds. The challenges that globalization, new information and communication technologies present to traditional, culturally bound beliefs and values. The critical function of socio-cultural, socio-psychological, and historical variables in the creation of belief and value systems. [24L, 12T]
